title: Inspector General Says U.S. Aid May Be Flowing to the Taliban
description: The special inspector general for Afghanistan’s reconstruction accused the Biden administration of blocking his efforts to track assistance.

title: Uneven Cease-Fire in Sudan Makes Escape Hard for Desperate Civilians
description: The army and the paramilitary group it is battling agreed to a 24-hour cease-fire. But many residents were unsure whether the truce was solid enough to safely flee.

title: U.S. Defense Secretary Urges Swift NATO Membership for Sweden
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III, visiting Sweden, said he hoped that objections to adding the country to the alliance would be ironed out by midsummer, when member states meet in Lithuania.

title: Edinburgh Forces Homeowner to Repaint Pink Front Door
description: Miranda Dickson was told that the color failed “to preserve the character” of the city’s New Town district, a UNESCO World Heritage site. This week she painted the door peacock green.

title: Mystery Light Over Kyiv Prompts Sirens and Speculation
description: Theories ran rampant among the public and officials after the Ukrainian capital was illuminated by a sudden flash late Wednesday night.

title: U.S. Authorizes a New Round of Covid Boosters
description: Older Americans and those with weakened immune systems, groups still particularly vulnerable to the virus, may receive additional shots of the reformulated vaccine, federal officials said.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: India’s Population Milestone
description: Also, China’s nuclear buildup.

title: Here are the latest developments in Sudan.
Bear That Killed Jogger in Italy Is Captured
description: The governor of a province in a mountainous region of the country’s north sought to euthanize the bear, known as JJ4, but a court is reviewing the matter.

title: In Prosecution of Turkey’s Halkbank, Supreme Court Issues a Mixed Ruling
description: The justices rejected key arguments from Halkbank, which is owned by the Turkish government. But they told a lower court to revisit one possible defense.

title: How Russian Propaganda Plagues Parts of Eastern Ukraine
description: A year into the war, some residents of eastern Ukrainian towns still confound officials and the police with their support for Russia despite the constant bombardment from Russian forces.

title: How to Understand the Fighting in Sudan
description: Looking at the history of coups — both the successes and the failures — can help put it the week’s chaotic events into clearer perspective.

title: Austin Defends Giving Young Service Members Access to Classified Data
description: After a 21-year-old Air National Guardsman was accused of leaking top secret documents, Mr. Austin said the real issue was ensuring that all service members protect information.

title: Canada’s Federal Workers Strike, Disrupting Government Services
description: The largest public sector union in Canada went on strike on Wednesday over wages and return to office rules, causing delays to border crossings and passport and income tax services.

title: After Settler Attacks, a Palestinian Town Fears for Its Survival
description: A surge in attacks by Jewish settlers in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, amid inflammatory statements by Israeli leaders, has Palestinians on edge.

title: How a Terra-Cotta Warrior Lost Its Thumb to a Delaware Shoe Salesman
description: Michael Rohana stole the clay digit six years ago at a Philadelphia museum where he had been attending an ugly-sweater party. He pleaded guilty this week.

title: Austin will discuss more arms and aid for Ukraine during his European trip.
Japan and Other Countries Struggle to Evacuate Citizens From Sudan
description: As fighting persists in Khartoum, including at its main airport, nations have said they cannot repatriate their citizens or have no immediate plans to do so.

title: Contest for Children to Hunt Feral Cats Is Scrapped in New Zealand
description: The country aggressively tries to control invasive species, but the culling event, which was to be part of a bigger hunting competition, generated a backlash.

title: Sudan Live Updates: Airstrikes Hit Khartoum Airport as Civilians Reel From Clashes
description: Warplanes struck Sudan’s main international airport, and rival paramilitaries fired on them with antiaircraft guns. The fighting continued into a fifth day after an announced cease-fire unraveled.

title: India Is Surpassing China in Population
description: We look at India’s looming status as the world’s most populous country and also give you the latest on the Fox News settlement.

title: U.S. Defense Secretary Visits Europe for Meetings on Aid to Ukraine
description: Lloyd J. Austin III has arrived in Sweden and will travel to Germany this week. President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine has expressed frustration about delays in arms deliveries. Here is what we’re covering.

title: Sudan’s Generals Dined With Peace Negotiators. Then Started a War.
description: What led the two generals, recently allies, to turn their forces on each other — devastating a country of 45 million people?

title: China Is on Track to Become Nuclear Superpower, Ushering in New Age
description: China is on track to massively expand its nuclear arsenal, just as Russia suspends the last major arms control treaty. It augurs a new world in which Beijing, Moscow and Washington will likely be atomic peers.

title: The R.S.F. posts a video showing its fighters outside the presidential palace.
Death Toll in Beijing Hospital Fire Soars to 29
description: Officials say a preliminary investigation found that the fire started when sparks from a construction project ignited paint. A dozen arrests have been made.

title: India Is Passing China in Population. Can Its Economy Ever Do the Same?
description: India has a young, vast work force that is expanding as China’s ages and shrinks. But the country’s immense size also lays bare its enormous challenges.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Fox News settles a defamation suit.

title: Why China’s Shrinking Population Is a Problem for Everyone
description: China struggled for years to curtail its rapid population growth. Now that its population is declining, economists and others fear serious implications for China and countries around the world.

title: Zelensky and Putin Make Dueling Trips to Front Line in Ukraine
description: The visits by the Ukrainian and Russian leaders came as both sought to display strength and confidence ahead of an anticipated Kyiv counteroffensive.

title: Here are the latest developments in Sudan.
Russia Is Importing Western Weapons Technology, Bypassing Sanctions
description: Western technology goods are winding up in Russian missiles, raising questions about the efficacy of sanctions.
